intro: Neotorularia humilis, commonly known as the slender torularia, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the family Torulaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, thread-like stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces tiny, yellowish to greenish flowers that are often overlooked due to their size. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Neotorularia humilis is often found in temperate regions and is considered a minor component of the local flora.
